title: 'A bad time': Facing 211% inflation, Argentinians speak of their fatalism, resilience and hopes
summary: The deregulation of the economy and cuts in state aid introduced by far-right libertarian Javier Milei are fueling inflation across food, transport and energy, while wages struggle to keep pace.

title: Trump threatens to 'encourage' attack of NATO allies behind on payments
summary: A White House spokesman called the former president's comments at a campaign rally were 'appalling and unhinged.'

title: Côte d'Ivoire rallies to beat Nigeria 2-1 and win Africa Cup of Nations
summary: The Elephants' success on their home turf is their third title, adding to those won in 1992 and 2015.

title: Super Bowl 2024: How good is Taylor Swift’s boyfriend Travis Kelce really?
summary: The buzz around the Chiefs tight end's relationship with the pop star would almost make you forget that Kelce, who'll be playing in Sunday's Super Bowl in Las Vegas, is one of the best players at his position in NFL history.

title: Minister says France will end birthright citizenship in overseas territory Mayotte
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said there would be a constitutional reform to revoke birthright citizenship in the Indian Ocean territory, to fight a local migration crisis.

title: As Gaza war rages on, Israeli settlement expansion is accelerating in West Bank
summary: The year 2023 saw Israeli settlements expand in the occupied territory at a pace unprecedented since the signing of the Oslo Accords in 1993. Settler expansion has only accelerated since October 7.

title: Six Nations: Ireland trounces Italy 36-0
summary: The titleholders made it two wins out of two as they hosted Italy in Dublin.

title: New York Republicans focus on Jewish voters as Gaza war casts shadow
summary: The American-Israeli candidate Mazi Pilip is running to fill George Santos's House seat on Tuesday. The former Democrat has criticized those in her old party who do not support Israel.

title: UK's King Charles III attends church for first time since revealing he has cancer
summary: Charles and his wife and queen consort Camilla took part in Sunday services at St. Mary Magdalene Church in the east of England on Sunday.

title: Climate activists throw soup at Monet painting in Lyon museum
summary: Activists from a French environmentalist group called Riposte Alimentaire splashed soup onto Claude Monet's 'Le Printemps' at the Musée des Beaux-Arts.

title: Filmmaker Agnieszka Holland: 'I've always felt the Second World War wasn't really over'
summary: The Polish director, whose film Green Border was released in France this month, speaks to Le Monde about going to film school in Prague, moving to France, and the issues facing Poland today.

title: The right-wing takeover of Florida's universities
summary: Conservatives and the governor of the third most populous American state have embarked on a drive to regain control of higher education, in the name of a 'counter-revolutionary' mission designed to break the supposed hegemony of the left on campuses and 'defend the West.'

title: Our selection of 10 delicious croque-monsieur to try in Paris
summary: Whether topped with pastrami or truffled ham, made with toasted Japanese sandwich bread or a vegetarian version with comté, cheddar and morbier, this classic can be enjoyed at these 10 Parisian establishments.

title: Pro-Israeli groups are using digital guerrilla warfare against pro-Palestinian activists
summary: In France, several social media accounts have published the personal details of politicians, activists and influencers supporting Palestine across the Internet, inciting harassment. A preliminary investigation has been opened following complaints.

title: Paris 2024: An island on the Seine, a Green mayor, and 'the luck' of having the Games
summary: Mohamed Gnabaly asserts that, without the Olympic Games, he would 'never have been able to transform L'Ile-Saint-Denis,' a small town on an island wedged between two arms of the Seine that has benefited from renovations it had been waiting 15 years for.

title: Our die-hard obsession with virginity
summary: Le Monde columnist Maïa Mazaurette highlights the fixation on sexual innocence that persists in modern society.

title: Nordic artists give Israel the cold shoulder for Eurovision
summary: Many Northern European artists are calling for Israel to be banned from the competition held in Sweden. They protest against the violation of human rights in Israel's response to Hamas's attack.

title: Former PM Stubb wins Finland presidential election
summary: Stubb won 51.6% of the vote, beating former foreign minister Pekka Haavisto.
